intro: Setaria biconvexa, commonly known as rough false panicgrass, is a species of grass native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Setaria biconvexa is an important plant in ecological studies due to its adaptability and role in soil stabilization.
